Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way. Patrick Leahy said, "While some in Washington are trying to turn the clock back on health reform, Vermont instead is moving forward. , but rivals are nipping at its heels. The Chrysler Town and Country was the top-selling minivan in the U.S. last year, with sales of 112,275, or about 4,000 more than the Honda Odyssey. , he fingers the US diplomat in charge of postwar Iraq, Paul Bremer , and criticises the former secretary of state, Colin Powell , and the former national security adviser, Condoleezza Rice . John McCain told ABC television: I respect secretary Donald Rumsfeld . He and I had a very, very strong difference of opinion about the strategy he was employing in Iraq, which I predicted was doomed to failure. Thank God he was relieved of his duties and we put the surge in. Otherwise we would have had a disastrous defeat in Iraq. Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today" if Saddam Hussein had remained in power. He denies he made a mistake in not sending a bigger US force to Iraq in 2003.
